newsitem.title: CHINA: Sichuan gives tax break to firms incl. Changhong.
newsitem.headline: Sichuan gives tax break to firms incl. Changhong.

text.p: The Chinese province of Sichuan has chosen 37 local firms, including Sichuan Changhong Electric Co Ltd, to receive preferential treatment on tax and other issues, the China Securities newspaper said on Tuesday.

The newspaper said the provincial government wanted to encourage the companies to develop into large and competitive conglomerates and would give them extra support including tax rebates and priority in raising funds.
Changhong, the biggest TV set producer in China, posted net profits of 1.67 billion yuan in 1996, up 45.55 percent from 11.51 billion yuan in 1995.
The remaining 36 companies include eight domestic A share listed firms, six of them listed in Shanghai and two in Shenzhen, the newspaper said.

The companies will enjoy a 50 percent value-added tax rebate if they make new products on which they have patent rights. Other tax benefits will apply if they develop profitable new technologies, it said.
The companies will receive priority from the local government in the issue of corporate bonds and shares, and will be allocated loans from banks ahead of other firms, it said.
